text.0: whether ye travel far away or dwell in yonder light of heaven.
text.1: or in a mansion that is built above the sea come thence ye aśvins hitherward.
text.2: or if for manuye prepared the sacrifice remember also kaṇvas son.
text.3: i call bṛhaspati indra viṣṇu all the gods the aśvins borne by rapid steeds.
text.4: those aśvins i invoke who work marvels brought hither to receive.
text.5: with whom our friendship is most famed and kinship passing that of gods.
text.6: on whom the solemn rites depend whose worshippers rise without the sun.
text.7: these who foreknow the holy work of sacrifice and by their godhead drink the sweets of soma juice.
text.8: whether ye lords of ample wealth now linger in the cast or west.
text.9: with druhyu or with anu yadu turvaga i call you hither come to me.
text.10: lords of great riches whether through the firmament ye fly or speed through heaven and earth.
text.11: or with your godlike natures stand upon your cars come thence o aśvins hitherward.
